title: The trve petition of Colonel Hvme as it was presented to the Lords assembled in the high court of Parliament being then one of the poore brethren of the famous foundation of the Charter house : declaring to their lordships that if they would be pleased to imploy him for the businesse in Ireland and let him have but sixscore or an hundred instruments of war : which he should give direction for to be made : he would ruine the rebels all within three months or else lose his head : likewise he will undertake within three months if their lordships would but give credence to him to bring in by sea, being furnished with a compleat Navy to His Majestie and the Parliament 20 millions of money.
author: Hume, Tobias, d. 1645.
notes: Signed on p. [8] : Tobias Hume colonell.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
